intro: Matricaria tanacetoides, commonly known as the German chamomile, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is characterized by its daisy-like yellow flowers surrounded by white ray florets, which bloom in the summer months. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has finely divided, aromatic leaves. Its essential oil, extracted from the flowers, contains compounds such as bisabolol and chamazulene, which are responsible for its therapeutic properties. Matricaria tanacetoides is widely used in herbal medicine for its calming and anti-inflammatory effects.
